channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Increased use of access only road due to London rd closure, 3rd September
item.description:
Lots of cars are now using School Road (which is access only) as a cut through due to London Road being closed for the bridge repairs. Given this road only had two passing points it’s causing traffic issues for residents (we are having lots of cars turning into our drive) and also pedestrians as cars are speeding down the road and the pavements are minimal or have cars parked on them. It’s dangerous especially with Balcarras back at school as it’s one of the main pedestrian routes. A sign at each end needs to be placed reminding cars it’s access only and not a suitable diversion.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 55, School Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Water flowing under gate into our property after heavy rain, 3rd September
item.description:
Junction of Blacksmiths Lane, Deep Street and Bouncers Lane. Water appears to flow down Blacksmiths Lane after heavy rain, then accumulate at the junction to a depth of several inches. Some of this water flows under our gate and into our back garden (the wooden gate visible in the photograph). We are fearful that if this continues there may be a risk of the house flooding too.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Deep Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping, 3rd September
item.description:
There are a number of items of furniture that have been abandoned in Cypress Garden and Evergreen walk. Outside no19 on the foot path there is a table and a storage unit left on public footpath. Behind 8 Evergreen walk in the hedgerows along the back of parking area there are two chairs an old food waste bin and a children’s basketball hoop, and just on the path there is a suitcase. It would be very much appreciated if it could all be collected as making the area look unpleasant
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cypress Gardens, Longlevens, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Flytipping (not witnessed and no evidence likely)

item.title: Drains not working, 3rd September
item.description:
Drains at Everest road and Old Bath Road junction are not fit for purpose as rain pours down from Leckhampton hill. My driveway/Garage has now flooded 3 times, whilst the neighbor has had water flooding up from toilets and showers.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Everest Road, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken glass, 3rd September
item.description:
Reported over a week ago. Great danger to wildlife. Still not cleaned up. Please remove it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bath Parade, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sign required re road closure, 3rd September
item.description:
A sign needs to be put here to tell HGV drivers to turn around and use the correct diversion route (due to the closed A40 / Hambrook bridge repairs) and that they must not travel through the village. The village is in chaos and the traffic poses a danger to pedestrians as traffic is using the pavements to get through. Children have returned to the three schools in the village and the volume of traffic is very dangerous
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Woodgate Close, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Information board identifying emergency contact company/number not displayed

item.title: A40 closure leading to numerous issues on east end rd / church st, 3rd September
item.description:
No weight / size limit for larger vehicles clearly displayed leading to numerous lorry’s using the route ( 2 stuck now) yesterday several there too. Cars / vans mounting pavements in school times near pupils Car could maybe only park on one side of the road Traffic officer / lights needed at peak times to stop / go near Yangtze / Merryfellow Aggressive behaviour of drivers It’s day 2 and already so many issues

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 64, Church Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Information board identifying emergency contact company/number not displayed

item.title: HGVs too large to come through village. Need size limit imposed for Church Street, New Street, East End Road, Hearn Road, at least., 3rd September
item.description:
URGENT - 2 HGVs are stuck on Church Street outside Charlton Kings Club and Coopers Court, (elderly flats), causing traffic issues and potential accidents for pedestrians and children as school finishes. One of these has been there since around 8.45am.

item.title: Drain is blocked again!, 3rd September
item.description:
On the corner of portland street outside of the cotswold inn the flooding is almost to my frontage and at risk of flooding my cellar bar. My customers are also getting soaked by the buses that come past regularly and plow through the huge puddle. I have to report this issue every year and every time I am told these drains are clearly regularly however I know for a fact that they are not as I live on site and and here every day and they are ALWAYS blocked.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Portland Street, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Inadequate drainage leads to driveway flooding, 3rd September
item.description:
We live in number 30. When it is heavy rain there is no drains between our property and the corner of the green on Barnmeadow Road. Our driveway is the lowest point and we are consistently getting flooded. It has almost come in to the house twice if not for us manually removing water with buckets and opening the drains. The water has go past our property to hit two drains so if it is heavy rain we are flooded. This is a huge risk - luckily I have been working from home the last few times but if it happens while I am out our house will flood. This has been happening for a few years now.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barnmeadow Road, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No drainage, 3rd September
item.description:
This manhole has constantly issues. Last year I was told it’s not blocked, but clearly it is. Throughout these past months we kept the area around it tidy, free of leaves/mud/anything else, but still this is an issue. Please come and fix this otherwise next time we’ll see water coming inside. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Vineyard Street, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet
